intro: Fagonia socotrana var. somalica, commonly known as the Somaliland fagonia, is a shrub native to the Horn of Africa, particularly found in Somalia and parts of Yemen. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
